results.title: A Cruel inheritance (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The problems and options of parents who risk passing on an inherited disease to their children are discussed. The program uses case studies of families with sickle cell anaemia and cystic fibrosis.

results.title: A Crowded wilderness
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roger Hart and Grant Kennedy
results.brief_description: Spacious, limitless as they may seem, Canada’s National Parks may not be able to keep up with the demands made on their resources without a continuing program of extending the parks system. Wilderness may, in fact, be the greatest heritage this generation of Canadians can leave to future generations. The problems, and the need to act now, are well defined in this film by concerned conservationists.

results.title: A Crop of records
results.brief_description: In 1960, Victoria’s wheat growing record was smashed by a bumper harvest. 95% of the wheat was from varieties bred by the Victorian Department of Agriculture including Pinnacle; Insignia; Beacon; and Olympic. Don Rooney, an agronomist in the Wimmera region talks to Victorian farmer Harry Bouchier about his record harvest. We follow the wheat’s journey from the farm, to the silos and finally being loaded onto cargo ships at the Port of Geelong headed for international destinations.

results.title: A Critical guide to the metaphysical poets
results.creator_credit: Cromwell Productions, Vanessa Tovell and Chris Gormlie
results.brief_description: This documentary, about the metaphysical poets of the 17th century, is a mixture of historical recreations and interviews. Although about an array of poets, the focus is primarily on John Donne, a renowned poet, whose elegant musings on love, religion and spirituality garnered him great favour with the rulers of the day. The metaphysical poets operated in a time of great upheaval in society. Advances in science meant that long held beliefs were being challenged; indeed this period saw the shift from Medieval to modern. The metaphysical poets specialised in verse that celebrated physical and romantic love, but also combined these sentiments with thoughts on spirituality, government and state, and changes being wrought in society.

results.title: A Crime to fit the punishment
results.brief_description: In 1954, during the height of McCarthyism and the Cold War, the controversial labour film ‘Salt of the Earth’ was made despite numerous attempts by the film industry and the U.S. government to prevent its production. This film explores the background that surrounded the film’s production, combining interviews and production footage with newsclips and broadcasts from the early fifties. It captures the struggle of the blacklisted Hollywood film people who defiantly set out to commit a crime to fit their punishment. Narrated by Lee Grant.

results.title: A Creative partnership: the actor and the director
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Eric Halliday and Cynthia Controp
results.brief_description: Traces a segment of a feature film from casting to the actor-director relationship through these various stages. Very useful for senior media studies students as it makes tangible the relationship between the director and the actors. Also shows the actors negotiating their parts with the director, making input into how the part is to be played. Featuring Michael Caulfield as the director, Noni Hazelhurst and John Derum as the actors.

results.title: A Craven
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Anne Algar
results.brief_description: Smoker Jenny Craven recounts the tortuous process of quitting smoking - which is proving as difficult as they predict when everything seems to be conspiring against her. Features the voices of Jean Kitson and Brian Nankervis.

results.title: A Country practice: the wedding
results.creator_credit: JNP Films, Lynn Bayonas and Brendan Maher
results.brief_description: Television soaps are famous for their elaborate funerals, births and weddings, and long-running Australian favourite “A Country Practice” was no different. This episode features the long awaited wedding of city doctor Simon Bowen to local vet Vicky Dean. Between last minute patient emergencies and an injured horse requiring urgent attention, locals wonder - will Simon and Vicky make it to the church on time?

results.title: A Cottage on Dartmoor
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films and Anthony Asquith
results.brief_description: Released with a synchronised music disc in 1930, but essentially regarded as a silent film. Anthony Asquith last ‘silent’ film was considered a rival to Hitchcock’s ‘Blackmail’. Presents the unrequited love of a barber’s assistant for a manicurist and the results of his jealous rage when she becomes engaged to a customer, relayed in a long flash-back during his attempted escape from Dartmoor. Cast includes: Norah Baring, Uno Henning, Hans Schlettow and Judd Green. Photographed by Stanley Rodwell. Story by Herbert C. Price.

results.title: A Cosmic christmas
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Nelvana, Patrick Loubert, Michael Hirsh and Clive A Smith
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a small town rediscovers the real spirit of Christmas thanks to three alien visitors from outer space and a little boy named Peter. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.
